page.title: 09HOUSING: Prices
page.content: Most post-war houses are away from main roads.Many modern homes are semi-detached but some are dormer bungalows.The estate in our area have been developed on farm land, Few working farms are left.Ex-farm buildings are renovated or converted making expensive family homes, many have a couple of hectares and a vareity of buildings. Houses today are either semis or detached.There are still a few old houses which are mainly terraced. A lot of house are bought with a mortgage.Houses today cost for a semi. about Â£25000, for a detached about Â£35000, for a bungalow about Â£25000 and for a terraced about Â£20000.The rates for a modern house are about Â£700 a year,whereas with older houses it is only about Â£100.
